Package ss.pentago.model.move

Class Rotation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.pentago.model.move.Rotation
  • public class Rotation
extends java.lang.Object
    Encodes a Rotation of a Quadrant, either clockwise or counterclockwise.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      {@code Rotation​(Quadrant quadrant, boolean clockwise)}
      Create a new Rotation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rotation

        public Rotation​(Quadrant quadrant,
                boolean clockwise)
        Create a new Rotation.
        Parameters:
        {@code quadrant} - quadrant to rotate
        {@code clockwise} - rotation direction

    • Method Detail

      • getQuadrant

        public Quadrant getQuadrant()
        Get the associated Quadrant.
        Returns:
        the quadrant to rotate

      • getClockwise

        public boolean getClockwise()
        Get the associated direction.
        Returns:
        true for clockwise rotation, false for counterclockwise

      • getCode

        public int getCode()
        Compute the code of a Rotation, as determined by quadrant and rotation direction.
        Returns:
        -1 if quadrant is invalid (i.e. null), else the code as per below: 
         0  top left counter-clockwise
        
 1  top left clockwise
        
 2  top right counter-clockwise
        
 3  top right clockwise
        
 4  bottom left counter-clockwise
        
 5  bottom left clockwise
        
 6  bottom right counter-clockwise
        
 7  bottom right clockwise

      • parseRotation

        public static Rotation parseRotation​(int rot)
                              throws RotationFormatException
        Parses the int argument as a {@code Rotation}. The int must be between 0 and 7 (inclusive), which covers all possible 4 quadrant along with all possible 2 rotation directions (clockwise and counterclockwise).
        Parameters:
        {@code rot} - the rotation code
        Returns:
        a corresponding {@code Rotation}
        Throws:
        {@code RotationFormatException} - when rot is out of bounds

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this {@code Rotation}.
        Overrides:
        {@code toString} in class {@code java.lang.Object}
        Returns:
        string representation
